page.title: 16LOCAL ISSUES
page.content: Here is an up to date summary of the local issues of most concern on Friday the 20th September 1985, as highlighted by the{Falmouth Packet.} Of major concern is the proposed re-development of Falmouth docks area. One plan envisages a 600 space car park, overlooked by a new supermarket. In a similar vein, objections are being raised to the proposed building of a big block of flats on the seafront, which local residents say would block out their view of Falmouth Bay.However, both developers and objectors are agreed on one thing- it's one of the finest panoramas around. On the letters page a major talking point is whether centralised government should legalise mass medication by flouridating the water supply.
